page.title: 16CHURCH GRESLEY
page.content: {The Domesday book}states that William 1st gave lands in Staffs and Derbys to {Sir Nigel de Stafford}who later took the name de Gresley when he made Gresley his chief residence. In 1135 {William de Gresley}founded a priory of {Augustinian Canons}in Church Gresley. A castle was also built at Castle Gresley. After dissolution in 1540 the priory lands were sold changing hands many times until 1828 when {Gresley Hall}was built on the site of the old priory.The{Parish Church of {S.S.George and Mary}was appropriated to the priory at an early date and formed part of the monastic buildings. On dissolution the chancel was pulled down.In 1786 the church was partially restored,& in 1872 a new chancel was buillt.The church today consists of chancel,nave & N.aisle, with an embattled tower at the E.end.
